content.question: One reason consumers typically increase the quantity of a good they purchase when the price of the good decreases is that

choices.label: the marginal utility of the good increases
consumers increase their purchases of substitute items
consumers increase their purchases of complementary items
the demand for the good increases

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
